positions.title: Senior Software Engineer
positions.description: Organize and coordinate company-wide transformation projects. Design, architect, and develop financial software. Utilize programming languages like C# and C++ to create Web APIs, Web applications, and Windows desktop software. Practice SCRUM on a team of 11 people.

positions.title: Software Engineer
positions.description: Design, architect, and develop financial software. Utilize programming languages like C# and C++ to create Web APIs, Web applications, and Windows desktop software. Practice SCRUM on a team of 11 people.

positions.title: Computer Science Tutor
positions.description: Coach and mentor students in Computer Information Systems field, motivate students, assist in evaluating studying techniques and learning styles, build relationships with students and colleagues with diverse backgrounds, and model professional academic behavior.

positions.title: Tech Service Assistant
positions.description: Assist the IT Department with staff requests, wipe old computers and image new ones to swap out, troubleshoot problems with current hardware and software, and communicate with IT employees and St. Scholastica staff.

positions.title: Web Assistant
positions.description: Created, modified, and analyzed websites used in the CIS 1001 course on campus, created scripts for automatic quiz generation from a Google Sheet, troubleshooted bugs in website/systems.

projects.name: SqliteMemoryDatabaseProvider
projects.description: NuGet package for .NET 6.0 and above applications for creating in-memory SQLite databases to be used within unit tests.

projects.name: EntityFrameworkCore.Concurrency
projects.description: NuGet package for .NET 6.0 and above applications for handling concurrency conflicts in EntityFramework.
